description: Learn the syntax, selectors, and properties used to style HTML elements with CSS.

slides.title: What is CSS?
CSS Syntax
slides.content:
# CSS Syntax ðŸ“

A CSS rule consists of a **selector** and a **declaration block**.

```css
h1 { color: blue; font-size: 12px; }
```

- **Selector (`h1`):** Points to the HTML element you want to style.
- **Property (`color`):** The style attribute you want to change.
- **Value (`blue`):** The value for the property.
- **Declaration:** `property: value;` (separated by semicolons).

slides.title: CSS Comments
slides.content:
# CSS Comments ðŸ’¬

Comments are used to explain code and are ignored by browsers.

Starts with `/*` and ends with `*/`.

```css
p {
  color: red; /* Set text color to red */
}

/* This is
a multi-line
comment */
```

slides.title: Cascading Order
slides.content:
# What is 'Cascading'? ðŸŒŠ

When multiple styles apply to the same element, which one wins?

**Priority Order (Lowest to Highest):**
1. Browser default (e.g., standard h1 size)
2. External and Internal style sheets (in head section)
3. Inline style (inside an HTML element)

**Inline style** has the highest priority and overrides others!

*(Note: `!important` rule overrides everything, but use with caution.)*
